title: Rose Byrne dons a auburn wig as she takes to streets of Manhattan to film TV series Mrs America
text:
Rose Byrne certainly looked different as she stepped into character for the TV series Mrs America.

The 40-year-old actress donned an auburn wig for her part as Gloria Steinem in the upcoming US show.

She was spotted mid-scene during filming on Saturday in New York's Upper East Side.

Stepping back in time: Rose Byrne (pictured) was spotted mid-scene during filming on Saturday in New York's Upper East Side

Dressed in a beige overcoat and 70s style maroon pants, the Sydney-born actress looked the spitting image of the American feminist icon.

She covered her trademark brunette locks with the striking wig and wore a pair of old fashioned specs.

Stepping back in time for the part, the Instant Family star looked barely recognisable as a redhead.

In character: Rose struck a sombre figure as she stood on the edge of the street, juggling bags of heavy luggage

Spotted! Rose looked surprised as she was approached by someone with a phone in their hand

Wigging out! The Instant Family star looked barely recognisable as a redhead for her part

She struck a sombre figure as she stood on the edge of the street, juggling bags of heavy luggage.

In another shot, Rose looked surprised as she was approached by someone with a phone in their hand.

The American TV series will tell the true story of the movement to ratify the Equal Rights Amendment through the eyes of the feminists involved.

Spitting image! The 40-year-old actress donned the auburn wig for her part as Gloria Steinem in the upcoming US show. Gloria is pictured in 1972

Last year, Cate Blanchett was confirmed for the show's lead role.

Rose's filming comes after she stepped out on the red carpet for a film festival in New York last month.

The actress, who was accompanied by partner Bobby Cannavale, drew attention to her smooth visage and trim figure in a black silk dress with cut-out detail.
